snippet: Jane Helser recently retired from working at the Wilson Sporting Goods factory in Ada, Ohio, where employees accustomed to precise specifications see the Patriots’ deflation scandal as a distant issue.
abstract: Wilson Sporting Goods factory in Ada, Ohio, has made footballs to NFL's exacting specifications for 48 years and workers are stunned by so-called Deflategate scandal involving New England Patriots; controversy arose out of accusations that Patriots underinflated footballs in AFC championship game against Indianapolis Colts.
lead_paragraph: Jane Helser recently retired from working at the Wilson Sporting Goods factory in Ada, Ohio, where employees accustomed to precise specifications see the Patriots’ deflation scandal as a distant issue.

headline.seo: Watching Patriots Scandal From Afar, a Retired Football Maker Says Wilson Did Its Job
headline.main: A Seamstress Who Handed Off to the N.F.L. for 48 Years
headline.print_headline: Handing Off to the N.F.L. for 48 Years
